diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute infective endocarditis of the tricuspid valve
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acute infective endocarditis of the tricuspid valve was supported by the patient's history of intravenous drug abuse, fever, chills, positive blood cultures for Staphylococcus aureus, and echocardiographic findings of large vegetations and an abscess of the valve, leading to the need for surgical intervention.
